Posts.Content: there are so many things that determine how many treatments, age, your health at time of diagnoses. how advanced the cancer is, just to name a few, I was diagnosed with Bread C, in Nov,   small tumor but had mastectomy anyway.  Lymph nodes  were all clear but the tissue that was against the chest wall (tumor was very close the chest wall way back in the boob,  didn't make my oncologist happy.  Cell structure wasn't what he wanted to see, so now I having chemo but only 4 treayments..  Not sure about radiation yet.  This has all been my decision, with  a lot advise from my Dr.s     I don't feel great right now but it will be worth to not have to worry about  a recurrence in a couple of years.  I'm am 65 so that helps.  I will be put on Herseptin (sp) for 5 years following treatment,   That medication depends on the age of the woman,  if per-memopausal  most likely it would be timoxifin . Hope that clears up some the confusion. but you really need to talk Dr.s and nurses to help you figure it out Good luck Donna
Posts.Title: number of chemo sessions

Posts.Content: I would take it.  Do you have to work the next day or tend to children??? I would still take it.  Zofran is what I was given, just put on my  tongue,  works pretty good.   Didn't make me that sleepy,  wanted it to, Glad to hear I'm not the only  one that can't sleep after treatment ,  Darn steroids!!! Donna
Posts.Title: Nozinan tablets for nausea after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi  It's been a busy week for me,  started Sun. with head cold,  didn't run a temp so had port put in on Monday. Had first treatment on Tues.  Felt great Wed.   the rest of the week not so good.  I was wondering just how long it takes to feel some what good again,  Not sure if the head cold// flu. has got me down or just a combination of things. I have not run a temp so that is a good thing, just alot of muscle aches and cough.  (Always have that :(  )  Thanks for any info you can  give me. Donna
